name: Telegram Bot
description: Connect Telegram using Telegram Bot API for seamless messaging
long_description: Telegram Bot API provides a straightforward way to integrate Telegram messaging into AgentOS. This channel allows you to receive and send messages through your Telegram bot, supporting rich media, inline keyboards, and various message types.

required_config_fields.name: bot_token
required_config_fields.label: Bot Token
required_config_fields.help_text: Your Telegram Bot Token from @BotFather (keep this secret)

required_config_fields.name: webhook_secret
required_config_fields.label: Webhook Secret Token
required_config_fields.help_text: Secret token for webhook verification (generate a secure random string)

setup_steps.title: Create Telegram Bot
setup_steps.description: Create a new bot using BotFather and get your bot token
setup_steps.instruction:
1. Open Telegram and search for @BotFather
2. Send /newbot command
3. Follow the prompts to choose a name and username
4. Copy the bot token provided by BotFather
5. Keep this token secure - it's like a password

setup_steps.title: Generate Webhook Secret
setup_steps.description: Create a secure random string for webhook verification
setup_steps.instruction:
Generate a secure random string (at least 32 characters) to use as your webhook secret token. This will be sent with webhook requests to verify authenticity.

Example using command line:
openssl rand -hex 32

setup_steps.title: Configure Webhook URL
setup_steps.description: Set the webhook URL in Telegram to receive messages
setup_steps.instruction: After saving your configuration, AgentOS will automatically register the webhook URL with Telegram. You can verify the webhook is set correctly by using the Test button below.

setup_steps.title: Test Connection
setup_steps.description: Send a test message to verify the setup
setup_steps.instruction: Click the Test button below to verify webhook and credentials. Then send a message to your bot on Telegram to ensure end-to-end connectivity.
